revised_title: Order-Disorder Phenomena in α-Brass: The Role of Atomic Mobility
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on copper-zinc and silver-zinc alloys to study the order-disorder phenomena and the role of atomic mobility. They found that the absorption of energy in these alloys is due to the destruction of short-range order, and the critical temperature is less than 75°C. The atomic mobility plays a significant role in controlling the kinetics of ordering and disordering in these alloys.
